mImages.description: A massive, forested crater created by the meteor in Season 4, featuring a central government research facility built to study the visitor.
A suburban neighborhood featuring a fast-food restaurant (Durrr Burger, later Tacos) and a surrounding residential area, often covered in ice during colder seasons.
A spooky, quiet graveyard in the northwest corner filled with crypts and tombstones, often featuring a large gothic castle on the nearby hill.
A northern scrapyard filled with compacted cars, shipping containers, and a large metal llama landmark, making it a high-material, low-traffic spot.
An East Asian-themed town with pink trees, pagoda-style buildings, and a large central shrine, located at the southernmost edge of the map.
A futuristic, neon-lit city that replaced Tilted Towers in Season 9, featuring slipstreams, verticality, and high-tech buildings.
A desert-themed metropolis with modern high-rises and a hotel that replaced the swampy Moisty Mire, surrounded by a large arid biome.
A classic, residential suburb with a central soccer field and park, known for being one of the longest-standing named locations in the game.
A massive, snowy mountain containing a grand castle (the Ice King's fortress), located in the southwest corner with ziplines for quick access.
A bustling shopping district and residential area, recognized as one of the original locations and a frequent hot-drop spot for loot.
